intro: Bryonia triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed bryony, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and squash. The plant is characterized by its trailing stems and heart-shaped leaves with three distinct lobes. Its flowers are yellow and unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The fruit is a rough, spiny capsule that contains several seeds.
